pullrequest.title: Small fixes for segfaults in Model, ODEJoint

content.raw: Can you create a test plugin that replicates the seg-fault?
content.html: Can you create a test plugin that replicates the seg-fault?

pullrequest.title: Small fixes for segfaults in Model, ODEJoint

content.raw:
Backtraces:

From gazebo on default with the handsim branch I linked to in the description, `implement_sim_api`:

```
[Wrn] [ODEJoint.cc:824] GetForceTorque: forgot to set <provide_feedback>?

Program received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
gazebo::physics::ODEJoint::GetLinkTorque (this=0x7fffce359340, _index=0)
    at /home/jackie/code/gazebo/gazebo/physics/ode/ODEJoint.cc:351
351	               jointFeedback->t1[2]);
(gdb) bt
#0  gazebo::physics::ODEJoint::GetLinkTorque (this=0x7fffce359340, _index=0)
    at /home/jackie/code/gazebo/gazebo/physics/ode/ODEJoint.cc:351
#1  0x00007fff9c761c10 in gazebo::HaptixWorldPlugin::ConvertJoint (_in=..., 
    _out=...) at /home/jackie/code/handsim/src/HaptixWorldPlugin.cc:915
#2  0x00007fff9c761f4a in gazebo::HaptixWorldPlugin::ConvertModel (_in=..., 
    _out=...) at /home/jackie/code/handsim/src/HaptixWorldPlugin.cc:877
#3  0x00007fff9c762287 in gazebo::HaptixWorldPlugin::HaptixSimInfoCallback (
    this=0x7fff60036550, _service=..., _rep=..., 
    _result=@0x7ffffff7dade: false)
    at /home/jackie/code/handsim/src/HaptixWorldPlugin.cc:200
#4  0x00007fff9c765a4d in operator() (__args#3=@0x7ffffff7dade: false, 
    __args#2=..., __args#1=..., __args#0=..., this=0x7fff60012de0)
    at /usr/include/c++/4.8/functional:2464
```

`wooden_case` is the offending model, we could try setting up a plugin where you call `GetforceTorque` on it.

With the `ODEJoint` change from this PR, but not the `Model` changes, the problem appears to originate from implicit deletes in the destructor of `HaptixControlPlugin`, a model plugin in this world...

```
terminate called without an active exception

Program received signal SIGABRT, Aborted.
[Switching to Thread 0x7fffd2465700 (LWP 22506)]
0x00007ffff4a66cc9 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6)
    at ../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:56
56	../nptl/sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c: No such file or directory.
(gdb) bt

...

#14 gazebo::HaptixControlPlugin::~HaptixControlPlugin (this=0x7fff6004bd30, 
    __in_chrg=<optimized out>)
    at /home/jackie/code/handsim/src/HaptixControlPlugin.cc:60
#15 0x00007fff58139789 in gazebo::HaptixControlPlugin::~HaptixControlPlugin (
    this=0x7fff6004bd30, __in_chrg=<optimized out>)

    this=0x7fff6004dd10)

#17 0x00007ffff73fe6f4 in ~shared_count (this=0x7fff6005b518, 
    __in_chrg=<optimized out>)
    at /usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/detail/shared_count.hpp:371
#18 ~shared_ptr (this=0x7fff6005b510, __in_chrg=<optimized out>)
    at /usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp:328
#19 _Destroy<boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::ModelPlugin> > (
    __pointer=0x7fff6005b510) at /usr/include/c++/4.8/bits/stl_construct.h:93
#20 __destroy<boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::ModelPlugin>*> (
    __last=<optimized out>, __first=0x7fff6005b510)
    at /usr/include/c++/4.8/bits/stl_construct.h:103
#21 _Destroy<boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::ModelPlugin>*> (__last=<optimized out>, 
    __first=<optimized out>) at /usr/include/c++/4.8/bits/stl_construct.h:126
#22 _Destroy<boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::ModelPlugin>*, boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::ModelPlugin> > (__last=0x7fff6005b520, __first=0x7fff6005b510)

#24 clear (this=0x7fffccbfbfe0) at /usr/include/c++/4.8/bits/stl_vector.h:1126

    at /home/jackie/code/gazebo/gazebo/physics/Model.cc:333
#26 0x00007ffff73a4ade in gazebo::physics::Base::Fini (this=0x7fffccc5f0b0)
    at /home/jackie/code/gazebo/gazebo/physics/Base.cc:105
#27 0x00007ffff742a4fa in gazebo::physics::World::Fini (this=0x7fffccd19900)

    _worldFilename=..., _paused=<optimized out>, _physics=...)
    at /home/jackie/code/handsim/test/ServerFixture.cc:234
```

pullrequest.title: Small fixes for segfaults in Model, ODEJoint

content.raw: I think a plugin that calls `Joint::GetForceTorque` repeatedly should be able to reproduce this.
content.html: I think a plugin that calls Joint::GetForceTorque repeatedly should be able to reproduce this.

pullrequest.title: Small fixes for segfaults in Model, ODEJoint

content.raw: current implementation has a lot of [broken tests](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/42)
content.html: current implementation has a lot of broken tests

pullrequest.title: Small fixes for segfaults in Model, ODEJoint
Small fixes for segfaults in Model, ODEJoint

content.raw: Running some of the failed tests with 46bf4fd appears to fix it. I may have been overzealous with my pointer clearing. [rerunning Jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/44/)
content.html: Running some of the failed tests with 46bf4fd appears to fix it. I may have been overzealous with my pointer clearing. rerunning Jenkins

pullrequest.title: Small fixes for segfaults in Model, ODEJoint

content.raw: got rid of the changes to the Model destructor since the segfault was originating from a blocked thread in HaptixControlPlugin, not from the destructor itself.
content.html: got rid of the changes to the Model destructor since the segfault was originating from a blocked thread in HaptixControlPlugin, not from the destructor itself.

pullrequest.title: Small fixes for segfaults in Model, ODEJoint
Small fixes for segfaults in Model, ODEJoint
